title: Ky. voters OK alcohol sales in Carp precinct
title_page: Ky. voters OK alcohol sales in Carp precinct
maintext:
ASHLAND - Voters on Tuesday decided 17-5 to allow alcohol sales in Ashland’s Carp precinct, according to Boyd County Clerk Debbie Jones.
Now considered wet like Ashland’s Central and Moore precincts, the Carp precinct will allow businesses to sell packaged alcoholic beverages in accordance with standing city ordinances, and restaurants interested in moving to the area may sell alcohol if they have 50 or more seats.
